For sure take her class at Chabot College in Hayward.

She's definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had. Super caring, understanding, and respectful. She always lets you make up work and helps if you don't understand something. Very little hw or quizzes, mainly lectures and classwork. Super fun to talk to about any topic. Highly rec taking ANY of her classes.

I took Professor Graver at Chabot College in Hayward California, she is truly a amazing professor, her class is easy and its a super interesting class. She even took us on a Feld trip for a lesson, she's a amazing and super chill professor.

She teaches Biological Anthropology and Forensic Anthropology at Chabot College, in Hayward, CA. I have taken both her Bio Anth course and her Forensic Anth course as well as her corresponding labs. She is by far the best professor I have ever had at Chabot. She is very textbook heavy in her Bio Anth course but not so much in Forensic Anth.

This class was not the worst. Her forensic anthropology class and great and enjoyable. The only part that was difficult were the exams. The first half of the semester would be exams then switched us over to assignemnt which were very easy. If you recieve bad test scores, dont worry about it. Just do the exams and the final project and youll pass.

Professor Sally is an Anthropology teacher at Chabot College! It wasnt ANTHR200 - at Chabot it was Anthro13/13L She is so excited about her lectures and i love her humor! Shes very helpful when it comes down to questions and she can definitely sometimes gives you a way to make up your assignments!

I took her anthro lab class this summer online at Chabot and shes the best! She makes her lectures interesting, homework/labs are reasonable and easy. No exams for the lab class so you have to do well on hw/labs. Available through email if you need help. Very sweet person! As long as you dont procrastinate, this class should be a breeze.

Hands down one of the best professor at Chabot College! She is also beautiful and has a very sweet voice. She does pretty excellent job in everything. Gives challenging tests which are all covered in her lectures. I got some low and high scores and my grade was -B then I took the extra credit she offered and my grade went -B to A. Shes the best!

Shes a very sweet anthro lab instructor at Chabot College! The exams were very challenging and covers around 4 chapters. Need to pay attention to your regular anthro 1 course in order to do good on exams. The slides she uses arent very helpful and goes through them very fast. She brings food often, no hw, helps w questions passed with an easy A!

Best Best Best professor ever in my entire time in Chabot College. I took her lab and there is no homework at all, only 1 hour lecture and then rest is lab time in class. The exams are based on the lab work and on the lectures. Just be on time in her class and attendance is very must. Just full attendance and stay active in her class you will get A

Even though this has been my lowest grade thus far at OSU, I'm not one to link grades to teachers.  She was a good teacher and straightforward with everything.  She shared her intriguing stories about trips to various places for excavations and such.  Despite my low grade, I would recommend her definitely.
Pretty easy. Shes interested in helping the students. Plus, shes a cutie.
Great class, very easy.  Lecture notes are excellent.  Not hard to come to class--she's very easy on the eyes.
Very good teacher, good lecture notes.  Easy exams.  Pretty hot.
Great class, provides notes, if you study and do the reading then its very easy
Easy to use lecture notes and extra credit oppurtunities.
Uses Powerpoint so you know exactly what notes to take. The tests are semi-hard though.

I enjoyed Dr. Sutton, her lectures were very engaging and I found a lot of the content to be very fun. Dr. Sutton is very understanding and it is very apparent that she wants her students to succeed and do well. Just be open with her and make an attempt to engage in class and she will appreciate it very much.
Dr. Sutton is concise and descriptive.

pretty uptight teacher, having a really high skill English comprehension/ using pretty big words seems to threaten her, and she will believe a faulty ai detector and threaten you with reporting when everything was 100% human written. so be sure to dumb your stuff down a bit otherwise you risk being flagged.

Definitely an easy A. Good lectures/slideshows with engaging content, but every assignment was essentially graded for completion with the exception of the labs/projects. Definitely a good class to get you into anthropology, or just to fill a GE requirement.

Easy A. Quizzes are open note. Projects are middle school science level. Prof is kind and lowkey funny. Labs are also middle school level. Only downside is lab reports and weekly reflections; they are both incredibly easy but so boring because they feel like elementary level. Best class to fulfill GE and honors requirements as non science major.

I'm here to make sure she has a 5 out of 5. Took her class in 21Spring, she's still one of my favorite instructors at OSU! You can feel she's super sweet, caring and passionate. Her exams are fair too.

Great professor and a genuinely easy A. Labs were worth small portion of your grade but you get full credit if a reasonable attempt was made. There were 3 exams worth most of your grade that weren't too bad so as long as you passed those you passed the class.

I took ANTHROP 2200 online for my bio credit (not a stem person) I thought the class was super boring but its pretty easy if you are just getting a GE credit. The online labs wernt supported on my laptop so i would fail everyone and I still got an a. If you enjoy learning about evolution you would love this class.

Really cares about the material. Very upbeat and interesting lectures. Makes you work for the grade but is reasonable. I really enjoyed the class. She did very well condensing 15 weeks of material into 6 week summer course. I am actually sad that classes are finished.

This was a great online course! She had a rubric for every assignment and as long as you follow that and put effort into your writing, you'll do fine. The subject was actually really interesting and surprisingly made me want to take more anthropology courses.

Professor seem to care about this class a lot. However, she doesn't respond to emails reached out to her and never got a reply back. Easy A for a GE, but be prepare to read every week for the quizzes and each quiz you get 2 tries and keep the highest score.

I took Introduction to Anthropology 1100 with her and I really enjoyed taking this class. She made going to lecture very interesting and cared that her students learn about people who are different than them.

Don't take this class lightly - the professor has a very strict attendance policy and can come across as unhelpful at times. However, the material is manageable with the textbook and using study tools like unstuck AI for practice.

Don't take any of her classes to just fill a credit. She came off rude and uncaring. May the the lord have mercy on you if you show up to the class 5 mins late, send an email asking a question or you utilize her "office hours" to get some help with her class.

Dr. Angel was a great professor! Her lectures were very engaging, largely because her passion for the material really came through and created a welcoming, accessible classroom environment. The assignments for this class are relatively straightforward with clear expectations and are quick to complete. Be prepared to think outside the box on exams.

Our TA was a tough grader, and the visual study guides account for too much of our grade for what they were, but overall an incredible class. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but I still went to every lecture because I enjoyed Dr. Angel. She's delightful and obviously passionate about teaching. Other than the visual study guides, a pretty easy class.

This class was pretty easy and enjoyable. The only grades are for the weekly culture "stories" that are easy to do well on and an open note midterm and final. It's mostly just lecturing but I found the subject matter interesting and Dr. Angel to be an engaging lecturer. There is technically a textbook for this course but you do not need to buy it.

2200 Anthropology is a very easy class just do most of the work and it is mostly participation except for the quizzes. If you can do decent on the quizzes then you will be fine. She is a good professor
Her grading style is horrible. She will always find something wrong

Dr. Angel is th MVP, she calls us her "lovely students" and always asks about our day. Hardly spent any time working for this course outside of lectures. No exams, quizzes were fine, and the only other assignments were posting comments on lectures, making visual study guides, and occasional quizzes. Labs based on completion.
nice professor and really understanding if you have questions about grades, but a very tough grader. almost never gives out 100% on assignments

She is the most inconsistent grader I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with. She does not make things clear; she says one things, but expects another. She has made me hate forensic archeology. We did 4 weeks of just mapping a scene (which was absolutely unnecessary and a waste of everyones time). She is intellligent, but a BAD teacher.
Easy lectures, tho some were a bit long. Stuff every week, but easy access thru Carmen. Solid into class.

Took anthro 1100 class from her online as a graduating senior to fulfill a GE. HATED the way this class was laid out. The way she uses Carmen is super confusing. Referring to the syllabus was no help because its was like 25 pages of rambling that wasnt even organized well. Expects too much for 3 credit hours, did way better in my 5000 lvl classes

Incredibly long and boring taped lectures that did not help much come exam time. Quizzes were easy and labs were incredibly confusing but were not graded hard. Exams were extremely difficult to get a good grade on even with hours of studying. The labs and quizzes would help to offset the terrible exams. Professor was very nice but not much help.

Dr. Angel is very knowledgeable, but I will say she is a tough grader and the grading is not always consistent. if you email her about your grade, she is very kind about it, letting you know what you missed and is willing to give back points for any mistakes/confusions. zooms were very insightful, chatting with experts from diff forensic fields

Only two assignments (two exams) that focus on lecture content. All other points in class are easy story/presentation assignments. Online lectures are okay but she sometimes just reads through the PowerPoints. Exams were difficult if only the lecture notes were studied. Still not a hard course to do well in. Do your homework and attend Zooms.

DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE. I took this class as a GE and it quickly became more work and stress than any of my other classes. The labs are graded pretty leniently but are confusing and difficult to do. Dr. Angel herself came across as a little condescending and rude. Tests don't have enough time and can be graded very strictly.
Online is fine, pandemic and all that

Took honors version and it was the most boring class ever. Half the class is easy A quizzes and labs. The exams are very tough because there is a lot of material. If you put in a decent amount of work you'll be fine. It is just a very dry class and the teacher isn't very fun.
I want to be an arcaheologist so this class was great info, and Dr. Angel was way helpful. I guess others here were not that into it.
Lots of homeworks, but take home and loads of time to complete. Not sure why people didn't like this class. It was fine for the level and major.

Dr. Angel is one of the worst professors that you will ever have. Every assignment she has is worth a ton of points, and if you do not do well, it drops your grade down by a lot. She does not even offer extra credit to help bring your grade up. Also, her test are super hard and she does not offer any study guide to help you.

She knows her material but can't teach very well. Her homework is hard and directions are very unclear, she gets mad when people ask questions. Gives no direction for studying, lectures are all over the place. If you fail a test good luck passing. Also homework is worth a crazy amount of points so don't mess up.

Dr. Angel is my queen. She is clearly knowledgeable on the subject and has experience. She had many -isms that I found amusing and made lecture an enjoyable experience. No study guide, although the content is pretty much straight from the textbook. Tests are fair and hard; but, labs count for half of your grade and they're free points.
Loads of info, loads of experts, work on a case throough class!!

Her instructions for assignments are like 5 paragraphs and often contradictory and confusing. Grading criteria is unclear. She takes off points for EVERYTHING. Miss one comma? Well then, the highest grade you can get is a B. No matter how hard I work in this class, I still have not managed to get an A on a single assignment. Do not recommend.
Tough but you'll learn alot.
Good choice for this class!
I don't understand some of these comments. She will pretty much excuse any absenc e with a drs note, flight email, etc. anything. And she emails back at nights and weekends too
If you are taking this as a gen ed don't! It was a lot of work and took a lot of my time up that shouldn't for a gen ed. A lot of writing every week, and exams were really hard.

Not sure why there is so much negativity about Dr. Angel. She is funny and will tailor the class to what you want to talk about. She doesn't give a study guide for her tests but the material comes from the notes (not the readings) and I did not struggle much with them (although I had some anthropology background). Lots of opportunities for points
Brings in outside lecturers, which I enjoyed. The exams include a wide range of information but if you're well prepared you'll be fine.
The book wasn't needed; anything on the test was covered in class. Dr. Angel is very knowledgeable and personable, so if you have questions, ask! Be prepared for lots of note taking and memorization.

Extremely inaccessible. She is rarely there because she has experts in the field teach the lectures. She often admits she doesn't know much about the different fields of forensics, so why should she test students over it? If you don't have an excuse for your absence, be prepared to miss take home quizzes. Tough attendance policy. Miss four and done

Dr. Angel makes Anthropology accessible and engaging. She does give study guides for tests, so test prep can be difficult, but labs and prelabs serve as buffers for your grade. She is very helpful if you ask for help. But you have to ask! You cant expect to have your hand held through this class.

She is the absolute worst. Spits out information during lecture and scratches it on the board in handwriting you cant read, then expects you to remember for an exam in 3 weeks. Her exams are impossible and she is a rude teacher to talk to. If you go up and talk to her about a bad exam she will lecture you on how you suck at taking notes.

Dr. Angel is an okay professor. You will have very few grades, and it's not going to be easy to receive an A. She has strict policies, and gets EXTREMELY POLITICAL in class. Maybe it was because this course was during election season, but I felt that 90% of this class was spent discussing non-related political issues that put us behind in material.

I really enjoyed this class with Dr. Angel. She is really sweet and very funny. Her lectures were always very interesting, and she does grade attendance. She gives very little homework, with one assignment per week that is not difficult at all. Her exams can be tricky.

One of the worst professors at OSU. I would never take any class she is teaching. Stay away from her class. Very rude when she replies to your emails (in case she does). Very strict on attendance, even though she is hardly there. Not willing to help you at all.

It's hard to rate this professor since she brings in guest speakers, who are experts in their field, to teach that part of the class. She doesn't give any info as far as what to study for the test and each test covers a substantial amount of info. Take home pop  quizzes are easy. No extra credit. I study very hard and still might end up with only B

Prof. Angel was a joy to learn from. She was obviously an expert in the field and had a myriad of interesting stories and jokes to go along with her lectures, all of which were clear and easy to follow. The textbooks she uses are good supplements to the course, but if you go to the lectures you can be guaranteed a good grade. Easy labs. Great class

By far my least favorite professor. The class alone is based on scattered information but she offers no help by making every assignment super vague. My biggest problem was she did not answer a single email, making it nearly impossible to contact her if you had questions. No study guide for exams & she grades hard. If you see her name at all, run!!!

One of the worst professors I have had here at OSU. Lectures are boring and basically consist of her just spewing out information, and then she expects you to memorize everything for her extremely hard tests, the same tests that she gives no study guide for. Everything is from the ppts, but she doesn't put them online. Avoid at all costs.
Labs were graded on participation, over 50% of overall grade consists of labs/easy prelab quizzes, exams could be difficult due to lack of study guide but were fair

We had a guest speaker almost every day, all but 2 days. Must attend class in order to pass, just based on points. Speakers were interesting because they are in the forensic fields they were teaching us. Does not give study guides. Literally anything could be on the exams. Study questions are confusing in the textbook but the book is interesting.
lots of homework but  we had no classes
liked it - loads of experts to talk to

I didn't enjoy the labs because they were just busy work and often needlessly confusing for how simple they were. Her tests are NO JOKE. You better have good notes. She is also easily diverted from topic during lecture, due to honors kids needing to show off. That part of the class was painful.
The experts have good stories about cases - some are tough tho.  Do everything the syllabus says or you won't pass.  Not easy, but why should it be

One of the worst professors I've had here at OSU. Not a fan of the expert lecturers; v. difficult to learn from them. Lectures are too dense for what the tests cover. Honestly, the book is your best friend. She's super strict about attendance but she's rarely there. Would not recommend this section unless you want to be frustrated.

She's really interesting and seems like a super cool person. She seems to actually care about her students. That being said, I feel like she makes the class unnecessarily hard. She says "she doesn't teach the test," but she writes the tests...Also, you MUST go to class to do well, she's super strict about attendance.

Fairly easy A as long as you go to class and do all the labs. The exams, although you can do bad on and still do well in the class, are hard. She doesn't give any review guide and gives you know idea what will be on them. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK - everything is on powerpoints.

Labs are easy. basically show up and you get the grade. Literally, I act like I am working. Easy reading every week for homework. Lectures are dumb, she just talks for the whole hour. Exams are HARD. she doesn't tell you anything that is going to be on the exam. She expects you to know EVERYTHING from notes, the book, the lab. I hate her class.

This class was one of the toughest AND most rewarding classes at OSU. Work hard & go to class, you will get an A. Her expectations are a little confusing at first but go to office hours & demonstrate that you're trying she'll help you understand. Problem is that many students want things handed to them. This is truly a university level course
This class was good - we had discussions about current stories, videos, and used the web to find out stuff nobody knew.  Loved it!

I have NO idea why most of these reviews are so negative. This was arguably the easiest class I took this semester. I mean, you really do have to go to class and pay attention, but it's all pretty straightforward. And Jules is really interesting to talk to!

Only take this class if you want and unclear and unresponsive professor. She takes her time answering emails, she test you on unclear during class. Her exams test you on factoids, rather than your knowledge of the material as a hole. She defiantly has a chip on her shoulder against teaching undergrads.
She makes you think not just learn - why is that so bad.  Mainly haters on here t seems

She is a very knowledgeable instructor but does teach very well at all. Here assignments a vague and be little's you if you email with a question. She assumes that you know a lot of things that a lot of us didn't know.
If you want to hate anthropology, she is the first choice,always.
She helped me alot during office hours.

She is the hardest grader I have ever had. Even harder than Dr. Jacobs in the Sociology department. She tests on the most scares subjects in the course and grades them extreme hard. If you ask to meet her outside of class to clear up a subject she acts like you are being a big inconvenience to her. This is the C+ I have received at OSU.

Extremely hard teacher! She gives you the tools to complete the class but god help you if you ask her a question by email or by stopping her office during  her office hours she will just treat you like you are stupid. She also thinks US sucks, so back to the UK then!! I changed my minor because of her!

I thought lectures were engaging and the topics interesting being an Anthropology Major. BUT she grades way too hard and the writing assignments are worth just as much as exams. Make sure to know her specific writing requirements and study well in advance for exams, they are really too hard for a GE class.

DO NOT TAKE. This was most boring and poorly organized class I have ever taken.The grading is unreasonably harsh for a GEC even an honors one. I am honors business student and this was my most difficult class. Professor only cares about outside research. Incredible amount of information given and tested on the most random points.

I took the 2201H class. The professor was interested in the material, but was unclear in lecture. STUDY for the exams well in advance -- they are HARD. There were very little points offered, making this an extremely hard class. If you're looking for an easy-A GEC this is NOT the class you should take. My GPA took a beating after this class.

Jules was a great professor. I took her honors anthropology course, which was the first time they offered it with a lab component. The course has some quirks that need to be worked out, but Jules was extremely helpful and willing to explain anything.  Doesn't use textbook at all. Great class, not the easiest but I would definitely recommend Jules.
Tough class but interesting; some lecturers are not great others are good. do the work and you will get a good grade.

Experst come into class to teach each subject; some are good some are not.  Angel corrdinates the class; we were never without a lecturer-she did not come some days as she was out doing forensic work, but there was a sub TA.  As for her TA emailing, I guess he knows the content and so doesnt need to take notes?easy pts doing take home study q's

One of the worst teachers i've ever had in my 4 years at OSU. Doesnt teach the class, responds with negative attitude in her emails, yells at class to be on time when she is frequently late and/or doesnt come, yells at class to not surf the internet in class even though her own TA surfs the web and emails non-stop. How is she a prof at OSU??......

Prof. Angel, as nice and helpful as she is, is probably the most disorganized prof. I have ever had the misfortune of taking a class of. She does not give guidelines, and is not helpful at all in setting expectations and giving instructions. Sit for one week in her class, and you'll see what I mean.

She doesn't teach 95% of the class but when she does it's hard to listen to her. She complains when students are late  even though she comes late very often if she even shows up. She is unwilling to help if you have a problem. Do not take this class if you do not want to be frustrated.
Awful. Ridiculous grader on papers. Way too much information. If you need a GEC, this should not be it.
Expectations for papers are ridiculous. Nice person though.

She's a really nice professor with a sweet English accent. She gives you a break in the middle of every class to go get coffee! However, her lectures are very scattered, her PowerPoints aren't very organized in my opinion. USE THE BOOK - even if she says not to, because studying just from your lecture notes will not cut it for the exam.
Good class, nice prof.
A lot of stuff to learn, but good class.
Cool class, always had a break in the middle.  Asks alot of q's in class so it's not all lecture.

If at all possible, TAKE A DIFFERENT SECTION. Angel's lectures are so scattered, making the book essentially useless.  Her exams cover the most obscure information and the class was a drag.  The only pro: her British accent.
Neat class; good professor.  Do the work, get agood grade!
Cool class with lectures by different experts.  There's alot for an intor class, but that is usually the case.  Have to keep up tho!

I don't know what to make of previous comments, but Dr. Angel is a great teacher. Attendance is mandatory and she can be a stickler at grading, and while we never used the book, it's all I studied from bc her notes are sparse and she gives most information verbally. She isn't a cultural anthropologist and gets her tests and notes from a supplier.

Dr. Angel likes to present most of her lectures verbally, with minimal powerpoint notes so you must pay attention in class or your notes will suck. The book isn't stressed at all in class but is helpful to read through when studying for exams. Attendance is mandatory! She is a really nice lady, so go to office hours right away if you're struggling!

Considering most of the bad reviews are posted 5+ years ago, I think her teaching style is no longer the same. Attendance is not mandatory, yet if you attend regularly she will be more likely to bump your grade up. Overall good teacher, straight forward exams. Biggest help is reading the textbook.

Very hard course.  Textbook is a MUST.  Also must rely on your own study and drawing (you heard right) skills to learn things almost entirely on your own.  Has a ridiculous mandatory attendance policy that she doesn't have any leeway on.  Nit picky on spelling.  Very stressful course.
You can bring one page of note to the exam. However, the exams were not easy.

This is the worst class I've ever taken! You have a different guest lecturer everyday even though Angel makes the exam...and she puts the most obsecure stuff on her tests that the lecturers barely go over! She is awful. Avoid this class!

This was probably the hardest, most stressful class I took during my college career. The reading material was needlessly complicated and jargony, and she made us give oral presentations on barely understandable stuff. I had a nervous breakdown mid-quarter. The only good thing was that she gave us lots of choices as far as exam questions went.
This class was fun, and you got to meet alot of experts.  I thought this was a place for students to find out about a class?  Can we please talk about the class and not have private conversations?
I learnt alot. thanks

If you are just interested in showing up for an A then don't bother with her classes.  She makes you work at getting a good grade - but isn'tthat good?  As for the previous comment - you have to show your true value thru your work, what else is there to grade?  Tough teacher, but you get alot out of it

I liked her. She's enthusiastic and helpful. She has relatively high standards for performance which is reflected in her tests. But I didn't think they were too hard. Don't take her if you're looking for an easy A; however, if you are interested in getting something out of a GEC and aren't painfully stupid, you'll like her.

i loved this class! jules was always so willing to meet and help with whatever you were having a problem with. the only problem i really had was staying alive for the entire hour and 48 minutes without a break.

she was really easy with her materials but she was really silly when it came to attendence for the simple fact that she treated us like little children. and as for the person whos comment was before mine, you must have been obviously one of her favorites cuz im not writitng this cuz i got a bad grade im writing this bad review cuz she was horrible!

What is wrong with you people?  Blaming the TA for a depressing class?  Blaming her when you get a bad grade cos you didn't come to class?  God forbid when you get a real job the boss will actually want you to come to work and do unhappy jobs for apaycheck.  Should college always be fun and entertaining - go work at Disney land.

She was very helpful to alot of people from what I saw, and the grades are based on whether you got a question right or not; that's simple.  The depressing matrial is really not her fault, that's reality for you.  Go to this class for some eye-opening stuff.  If you don;t study or go to class, expect a bad grade.

only take this class if you are interested and i mean very intersted in women's issues in developing countries. ATTENDANCE is required. if you are a senior looking for a very depressing serious class take this one. she was not very helpful and actually downright judgemental and grades on a person to person basis so get on her good side. NO GOOD!

She let the students run her class and she barely taught or kept the discussion on track. She had her favorites and if you were not one of them then she made it seem that your opinions were not valid ones. Even though she is a horrible GA, the course material is very intersting and the class is easy as long as you participate and show up.

If you want to do well in this class be prepared to attend class and pay attention.  Jules was willing to answer questions and keep discussions on track.  Some of what was covered was depressing but important to be aware of.  Would reconnebd for serious student only.

Lots of reading about diverse subjects and questions from readings are posted on a website and these questions are on exams too.  She is very STRICT about attendance, but if you don't go you miss quizzes, notes and ideas etc.  Sometimes the subjects are very depressing, but I guess not all course can be happy.  She knows alot and seems nice.

Great class, great GTA.  It's unfortunate that the material (which was really interesting) was wasted on students that mostly had no interest in learning about those less fortunate than us here in the USA and were only taking the class because it was required.  Encouraging to see a Prof. take their job seriously.  Attendance is highly encouraged.

Should not be a difficult class but her endless amount of work and tough grading make it quite difficult. But then, she is knowledgable on what she is teaching. If that count as a bonus. And be prepared to wait several days for her to respond to your email, if she will ever reply at all. You will be ok if u GO TO CLASS, PARTICIPATE AND DO HER WORK!

the worst teacher ever.has her favorites and you better hope your one of them or your not going to do well in the final, attendance etc. likes to send out stupid emails about low attendance, being fidgety during a movie and making us feel like we were young children.discussions horrible. if you want to get the class of track just say: walmart!
Did not like this TA at all.  Rude condescending emails and boring class.

The subject matter in this class is riveting -too bad she can't really manage to lead a discussion. The class isn't necessarily difficult, but grading seems arbitrary sometimes.  She has a tendency to send out patronizing passive aggressive emails if class doesn't go quite the way it should, if attendance is low, etc.

Thought she was a great teacher and fun too in the beginning until she sent out an email stating how disappointed she was at us for having been fidgety during a movie and how we should be respectful since its the U.S's fault.  Felt like a kindergarten student and having the teacher yell at me. also has favorites so better hope your one of them.

Interesting, informative.  Really helped me to see things from a new perspective and realize how ethnocentric we can be without knowing it.  Tests were fair--taken from the articles we studied.  She posted questions online for us to study from.  Would have preferred to have a textbook, but it is a class about the contemporary world...
Very entertaining and insightful- this class covered a lot of material but Jules did a great job with keeping it managable.
Very Interested in the material and willing to help.

I don't know what all the negative comments are about.  IN my class she was thrilled when we got above average on the test and gave more A's than are usual.  Her handouts are great, and office hours are also good for making sure you inderstand what's what.  She told us many times, "if I teach it, it could be on the exam" - so no surprises at all.

Horrible! Her powerpoints don't give you any information. She doesn't give you study guides so you never know what will be on the exams. The questions on the tests are hard and some of the most random things that you barely talked about during class. Do not take any of her classes.

She goes through the slides faster than most of us can write and that is a little annoying, but other than that this class was not too terrible. I didn't expect an A, I am not very good at memorization. I am hopeful that I will get a B or maybe B+. And I guess I am the only person who thinks she is kind of sexy in a sort of brainy chick way.

HORRIBLE!  Don't take any of her classes! She is out to get you! She is only a photographer and she doesn't know half about the stuff she says! You can study all you want but it is almost impossible to get an A on an exam. She isn't clear about homework and when you do it she will give you 0 out of 10 b/c she didn't explain it well enough!
This professor really jumps around in her notes and its hard to make sense of the material.  Not a fun class, very boring-amount of study time does not correlate to test scores.

This was quite possibly the most dissapointing class I have ever taken. I was very excited about the subject matter, and her vague test questions and inability to tell her students which chapters were on upcoming tests let alone provide any sort of study guide for them, completely ruined what could have been one of my more interesting GECs.
used a lot of slides that were pretty much pointless and confusing.

I would study hard and come away with C's. I was always unsure of what was going to be on the test so you would have to read everything covered more than once. Most teachers seem easier than she was, but it could have been the subject.

Her notes are typed-not off the internet (saw them in office hours!) You don't have to use PPT for every class, listening and interacting are just as important as looking at PPT:)  Using the book as a reference worked well.  Her foreign perspective got us thinking about another POV; smart lady.
No Comments

Pushes students to read the book as a reference.  Her powerpoints are crammed with photo's and diagram.  Class discussions helped me alot.  Always helpful in offcie hours.  Some of the theory is a little dry, but I guess that always is.

She lectures with no visual aids except for random words that she writes on the board.  The random words that she writes on the board are not that helpful.  The most confusing exams that I ever had to take, ever!  She made my headache with every lecture.
No Comments

this professor is IMPOSSIBLE. do NOT take her unless you are looking to fail and fall asleep during every class. you can study day and night for her exams. but the more you study, the worse you will do.
Exams are extremely hard and tricky. Her lectures are VERY VERY boring. You won't ever want to go to class, it sucks.... stay away!!!
She is very helpful but her grading is a bit bizarre sometimes with what she expects. Her British accent always makes class seem interesting.
Graduate TA but very knowledgable.  She is really smart and her class is really interesting. The tests aren't too hard but it is difficult to get an A because she doesn't curve.

I really enjoyed her as my professor and thought the lectures were interesting. I also felt that the labs applied well to the content and instead of having exams, there were weekly tests and module posters. The lab reflections were a bit time consuming but after the first few you get the hang of it.

I'm taking this bc my friends said it's an easy lab science. Prof is nice, but gives a ridiculously absurd amount of work for a GE. Each week there are: two 1+ hour long lectures (& the ppts are pics, no notes), 1 reflection, 1 lab on top hat (takes forever), and either a quiz or project. Other profs for this course don't have nearly as much work.

An easy, online GE course. She posts her lectures in video form, pdf, and powerpoint form making it really accessible. Tests are simple and all deadlines are flexible making it an awesome course if you have a busy semester. Would recommend as a GPA booster GE course, but not super engaging.
Good lectures and easy grader. Light workload.
Nice, caring, understanding

She is amazing. My class was asynchronous but she was always kindnerous The lectures were a lot to watch but the work that came along with it was a breeze. Just had to do 1 discussion post w 1 reply then a lab and prelab each week. Prelab was graded on completion. Was always there to help and did weekly reviews. Always answered emails so sweet.

If you read materials carefully and submit hw on time, you will get a A. Rebecca is generous, and I think she is the angel! She will help with your work and record a review video for the last week's content.

Rebecca is an amazing professor. If you do the assignments, chances are, you'll get a 100%. I had a few tragedies happen during the semester, and she told me to take my time in returning, and excused me from missing assignments.
Engaging and interesting. Shows interest in students.

One of the nicest instructors I've ever had. Genuinely concerned about her students and does anything she can to help you understand and will accommodate with any issues you may have. Didn't use the book, going to lectures and minimal studying is enough to do well on the exams. Had a great experience in her class. I would recommend taking her.
She is really nice but the class is so boring.

She's super nice, and will work around crazy schedules or whatever to help students. I struggled with the material- it was hard for me, but she found extra resources and suggested good study strategies and I got a good grade. Not a an easy class, but she made it as fun and painless as possible.

She is SO nice! I took it online and she seriously was there with any questions I had. She explains everything really well and is SUPER approachable. DEF TAKE HER. She's one of the nicest professors I've ever had!
Sarah was a great teacher. Some of the information was kind of dry but she makes it interesting. She is also extremely helpful and approachable. If you take 201 try to take it with Sarah.

Sarah is overall a good teacher.  Her lectures are very clear and she is very knowledgeable about anthropology. The tests and exams are challenging but if you study, you can easily get an A. She is a fair grader. You don't need to read the textbook, but you do need to go to class to get a good grade. Overall, I would definitely recommend her.

Yerkes was very kind, caring, and had a great sense of humor. The class contained a 1–2-page paper every 2-3 weeks, a take home mid-term, and a final paper 4-5 pages. This class was very easy, he responded to emails quickly, and wanted his students to pass. His lectures were a bit longer, he was very understanding, cant say enough great things

Dr. Yerkes is a good professor. Sometimes his lectures are a bit boring, but otherwise teaches well. His assignments are opinion-based, graded on completion. The midterm was open note, take home directly from the lecture slides (very easy to get a 100%). Attendance is required, for the large assignments 15points is attendance during discussion day.

Prof. Yerkes rambles a lot during class, if you want to learn from him, it's beneficial to sit in the front of the class. The take home midterm was easy and all of his papers are graded easily as well. The papers are opinion based so you can't be wrong. He is a very nice person and I enjoy talking with him.

I took this class for a GE and it was one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. His lectures are pretty boring and you can barely hear him half the time but attendance is not mandatory. There are only a few very easy assignments throughout the entire semester and he grades very easy on them.

Took 1101 for a GE credit. Dr. Yerkes is a super understanding professor and is very reasonable with assignments and grading. The coursework is extremely manageable and the content is quite interesting.
Took 1101 first time it was offered. Easy yet interesting class. Perfect for Race and Gender Diversity GE

I took this class as a GE for my social science requirement. Lectures were kind of dry, though he means well and enjoys teaching. Exams were take home and open note, and you're given like 2 weeks to complete them. As long as you use the textbook and a few outside sources, the exams are not bad. Just be descriptive. Very passionate about the topic!

Lectures were tedious. There were copious amounts of reading assigned. Exams were take home, and homework assignments were pretty infrequent. Yerkes was clearly very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject.

Easy class, you don't need to come to get an A. Only on days you have things to turn in/or a presentation. He's really nice and a super easy grader. His lectures are a little dull but you don't even have to show up because he posts them online! There is however a lot of reading. Midterm and exams are take home too

This is the easiest class I've taken at OSU. Prof Yerkes is really nice and smart but his lectures are pretty long and boring and you can't hear him half the time. You use the book for 4 take home exams. He takes attendance every class and theres 4 in class assignments so its worth it to go but most of your learning will come from the book. Easy GE

His lectures are very dry but he does try his best to be engaging and is always prepared for class. His exams are not very difficult as long as you review his lecture notes that he posts on Carmen. Our assignments also were not very difficult as long as you put effort into them he will recognize that and grade you accordingly. Very passionate!

Just finishing up his Anthropology 1100 class. He posts the lecture slides on Carmen. He tends to ramble and holds the microphone unnecessarily close to his mouth... 4 take home exams, 4 easy in class activities, 1 in class final. Honestly, I didnt learn much from this class. If you want to actually benefit from class, take a different lecturer.

Prof Yerkes lectures from a word document every single say in class. He tends to ramble. Participation grade is based on attendance. 3 papers, 3 short assignments, 2 exams (1 take-home). I didn't learn much from this class but it was an easy A.

Dr. Yerkes is very quirky with a dry sense of humor that you learn to appreciate later in the semester. Two tests are both take home and the final is non cumulative. There is a debate, but it was is really easy. Him and the TA grade very generously, and there are 3 other small essays. Boring class, but easy.

This is hands down the worst class I have ever taken. It is supposed to be a discussion-based class, but he interrupts students constantly. He does not allow any bathroom or food breaks, even though it is an almost 3 hr class. He is rude and disrespectful of students' questions, time, and life outside of class. The class is boring and useless.

Lectures are not the most exciting thing you'll ever attend, but Dr. Yerkes has a great sense of humor and is a super cute little old man who is very intelligent.  He makes jokes a lot and is very friendly.  The class has a total of 3 assignments, one debate, a take home midterm, a single essay, and a take home final.  Definitely use your book.

Yerkes is a good professor. Has all his exams straight out of his PowerPoint. You need textbook for homework assignments though. Exams are easy if you study. Doesn't post grades online so you need to calculate and see where you at in class to get desired grade. Doesn't curve. Lectures were not mandatory and where boring.

Professor Yerkes is a great guy who is funny and easy to listen to. If you pay attention in class and take notes, and study the book the night before the exam, you should pass. None of the exams are cumulative, and they are not that bad besides. Showing up to class is probably the best part of the course because of his cool stories too.

Three midterm, non-cumulative exams. Very easy material . Either need to read book (vocab) or go to lecture. Both is not necessary. Boring lectures. Exams are extremely vocab-based. Has like 5 quizzes throughout semester. Doesn't post any grades on Carmen, so hard to keep track of your grades. Very nice and understanding guy.

Professor Yerkes is hilarious. He trails off into the most random subjects quite a bit, but when he's on topic, he knows what he's talking about. You will fail if you don't read the textbook. He's not very strict about attendance. And make sure you use every source he provides; he's very picky about that.
Dr. Yerkes cracks me up. I felt like half the time he was talking to himself. Lectures are horribly boring. Class over all is pretty easy. He is a VERY easy grader.
Dr. Yerkes is such an awesome professor and I honestly feel lucky to be one of his students. He's really funny, a very fair grader, and I'm pretty sure he knows everything.

Dr. Yerkes may seem boring at first, but I soon realized that he is extremely interesting and knowledgeable, with a quirky sense of humor that is easy to miss. Do not underestimate the bearded gentleman in his strange sweaters. I miss having class with him.

He's a nice guy and definitely knows what he's talking about, but he isn't the best at communicating it. His notes are hard to follow (and hard to stay awake through) but you can use the notes as sources in the papers so it's worth it to copy them down.

Professor Yerkes is awesome! I'll be the first to admit that I'm not a stellar student, and this class is an E-A-S-Y A. Five short quizzes, three time consuming but easy papers, and a take home midterm and final. Yes, lecture can be boring sometimes, but he really knows what he's talking about, and is really nice.

Boring lectures, hard assignments, but the guy is knowledgeable on the subject and very helpful if you go to office hours. Exams are take homes and there are 3 assignments that require a lot of effort. Do the work, go to office hours if you need help.

Lectures were incredibly boring. I am not normally one to skip class, but I stopped going to his about halfway through the quarter. There are 3 main assignments (research powerpoint, midterm, and final papers), and as long as you rely heavily on the book, you'll be fine. Put in a few nights of intensive paper writing and this class is an easy A.

This class was terribly boring.  His lectures were not powerpoint, but lengthy word documents that were impossible to take notes from.  The exams were take-home, but really tedious.  He's not a hard grader necessarily, but the assignments did take a lot of time.

A little awkward, but definitely extremely knowledgeable about almost every aspect of archaeology. Easy enough class; two homeworks, an essay, a presentation, a midterm, and a final. No effort required for an A.
Prof. Yerkes is a very dedicated archaeologist. His personality is a bit quirky, but that is typical for the field. Very good professor, very interesting class!

ANTHRO 350. A class that I really looked forward to taking. Interesting material but I found his personality and manner odd and offputting. Friendly but very high strung. Willing to be helpful but in his office stammers a lot and looks nervously at the ceiling. As a woman I felt uncomfortable  in his office. I know from a friend who worked on his f

Dr. Yerkes may show enthusiasm, but he is one of the worst professors I have ever had.  He teaches from MS Word files, and he mostly goes over bones for the first half of the class and images for the second half.  You could read the book and not go to lecture to pass the exams, but you would fail if you attended lecture, but did not read the book.

Professor Yerkes was knowledgeable and informative. I could tell that he was very interested in his subject.  The class was not hard. Take home midterm and final, with essays. They took a good chunk of time, but weren't bad. A debate project was the other part of the your grade, and you worked in groups. He was a fairly easy grader, and fair.
Great guy!  He trys to make the class really fun  and interesting.

Understanding and informative. Show up, do the work, and you'll do fine. He's only frustrated when poeple don't show up for class. It's a fun, mostly lab-oriented class with one large assignment and easy tests.
No Comments
Great professor!  He is genuinely interested in teaching, which makes for enjoyable classes!
No Comments

I would 100% take this again, the class is very easy and notes are posted. Tests were open note and open textbook and he is very passionate and knowledgeable about what he teaches. Class content was surprisingly interesting.

100% asynchronous course: well structured and straightforward, light workload, with a decent amount of writing. Some assignment types can be dropped, and the grading criteria are unambiguous. Also, he's a cool guy! I wish I had him for an in-person class, honestly.

Great professor! Overall really cares about students and your success. Easy weekly reflections on what you learned, and 3 papers on articles. 3 online exams that are on your own time (open book and notes). Take him!

Very patient and clearly loves what he is teaching. Easy to stay attentive in his class because of his enthusiasm and genuine concern. Weekly "what did you learn" assignment and 3 easy article reflections all semester. Not a harsh grader if you try and do what was asked. On exams, he gave very generous answers when you asked about a question.
Great Prof. Even though I have no interest in Anthropology, he still makes the class fun and entertaining. definitely take it if you need a bio credit.

I've never been very interested in anthropology myself, but Dr. Peterson did a great job keeping our class engaged and doing our best. His workload was pretty light, mainly just weekly labs, a couple short weekly discussion posts, and a handful of projects. He has a lot of cool experiences to share from his past fieldwork as well. I learned a lot.

Dr. Peterson is one of the nicest and most passionate professors I've had at OSU. He clearly loves what he does, which shows in his classes when he shares personal stories from his time in the field and gets students' thoughts on the topics he teaches. Attendance is only for lab days, but you'll definitely benefit from going to all the lectures.

Not really any extra credit but weekly assignments are so easy its like its extra credit. Attendance only mandatory on lab days. Prof is super enthusiastic about what he teaches. GREAT EASY class to fill natural science GE. Have to pay for the online lab but it was not too much $. Quizzes are open note. Clear grading criteria on the 4 easy projects
He loves his work so it makes the material interesting. No memorization required, projects are unique. You have to buy the book though because you use it for labs.

He was a new professor and I was a little skeptical about taking his class but I'm glad I did. Labs were somewhat difficult but graded easy. Instead of exams, we did projects and open-note section tests, which were also pretty easy. Listened to feedback we gave and it made lectures better. As long as you give a decent effort, should get an A.

Dr Peterson is a genuinely kind, caring, and intelligent teacher. He asks for feedback and actually makes changes based on student suggestions. Grades are based on projects, open note quizzes, lecture reflections, labs, and one group assignment. Make sure to submit online quizzes on time. Would definitely recommend this class

Professor Peterson is genuinely a caring and passionate teacher. He gets excited about the material and it makes him happy to see his students interested as well. He constantly asks for feedback from his students and it is obvious he adapts his teaching methods based on what we say in order to us learn better. 10/10, would recommend. He is amazing.

This class was an amazing experience, I recommend it if anyone wants to just learn about food. There are some textbooks and light reading involved to understand discussions in class or tests. If you want a class that is engaging and the professor to crack some jokes (that are funny), then this is the class to take!

Dr. Cohen is one of the sweetest and kindest people you will ever meet, and you genuinely have to put no effort into this class to get an A. I don't think that means you learn nothing, it's just up to you to decide if you want to pay attention. He's a fascinating guy who can really teach you to love anthropology because he's SO passionate.

I have had Dr. Cohen in ANTHROP 3334 and this. He is my favorite professor. He helps anyone who is willing to work. He is intelligent, professional, and truly passionate. I loved being in his classes and I hope to take more of his classes! Our discussions make his classes some of the best in the anthropology dept. I recommend him to anyone in ANTHR

this class is extremely easy. Easy to the point where you are literally not being challenged to do anything but breathe in class. He always gets out of topic and wants to be your friend more than he wants to be your prof
Class is interesting and also very easy. You can tell hes super passionate about his research.

He is such a good man! His classes are very interesting and creative and he has many great stories, so you learn a lot. He is very caring and truly wants all his students to succeed. I truly love hearing him talk. He is always smiling and will talk to you after class. He deserves a free cruise and a lifetime supply of chocolate for his efforts.

Dr. Cohen is one of my favorite teachers that I have ever had at OSU. He's really nice, and know's a lot of cool information. His classes are also super easy, but even if they were difficult I would still take them, i've taken him for 3 classes, and will take him next spring again

Dr. Cohen, has so far been the best professor I've had in my college career. In some part because you can get an incredibly easy A, but also because of his character. Lectures could be boring at times, but his jokes kept me awake. As an anthropology major, he is a great person to talk to on insight on what to do after college with the major.
Show up to class and he literally gives you the answers. Easy 100%.

Jeffrey was awesome! I took his Zombie class and it was really easy, there are quizzes every class but he gives you the answers at the end of class and they are all in his powerpoints. You don't really need to go to class, but he's hilarious so I would go anyway. The final is just dressing up like a Zombie and writing a short paper about it

By far the best professor in the entire Anthropology department, I have taken 4 classes of his so far and he's the best. Makes class fun, makes you laugh ALOT, and best of all his classes are always super easy as long as you pay attention to lecture slides.

I did not like this man. He rubbed me wrong way. He made a few off the cuff comments that I found offensive. The Zombie class was supposed to be awesome, it ended up being my most dreaded class. I felt like most lectures were a far reach to the topic. The tests were very difficult. Each answer made scene and seemed like it could be correct.

Dr. Cohen is awful. He is zoo unbelievable unclear about even the simplest thing. He makes what could be a cool class solo boring and very difficult. I took a cultural elective and ended up getting a C because his tests are insane and not even logical. He is also mean and does not care to help student at all. I'M WARNING YOU, STAY AWAY FORM HIM

For Food Anthro Class: EXTREMELY EASY CLASS. Must attend lectures as class is small. Easiest class I've taken at this university. Cohen is funny--get to know him/on his good side, he tends to play favorites. His class is interesting and fun/laid back. Def recommend to anyone who likes food. Three tests, all typed and short answer.
XX
life changingly awesome

This guy is very enthusiastic about what he does and what he teaches, he always has a story to tell (in fact they're basically how he conveys his infinite knowledge).  As long as you read the books and show up to class you should get an A.  As previous students said, he can tell some pretty bad jokes, but you still appreciate his sense of humor.

Very helpful and knowledgable.  Tends to make a lot of bad jokes in class, but occasionally surprises us with a good one, and can hold my interest all the same.  A pretty easy grader too, so you don't need to worry too much about his quizzes and projects.

Dr. Cohen's enthusiasm and use of real life examples during lecture made this class interesting and enjoyable.  He was very clear about the material covered on his exams, and nothing was a surprise.  He was also understanding about redoing assignments for an improved grade.  A really nice guy and great professor!

I thought Dr. Cohen was extremely helpful and I feel as though I learned a lot from him. He gives real life examples; it is not just reading useless stuff and memorizing. You get to put your own insight and experience into your work. I def. would take a class with him again.
tough but fair I think.  I learned a lot.

Great class—online and super easy. The professor is very understanding, and the due date for assignments is open until the end of the semester. Generally, it's 1 lab and a paragraph due a week. However, some weeks have an open note, multiple-choice quiz per module, or module poster. Overall, good, chill class.
only grades on pretty simple exams

This class was super lecture heavy but it was generally really interesting. The fact theres only 3 exams for your grade was a little rough but they ended up being super fair and theyd get a small curve as well. All in all, he was a great professor, definitely would take again.

Grade for the class is based only on 3 exams but if you show up and pay attention to the lectures you will get a good grade. Lectures are very interesting and the depth of the topic is not enough to confuse those unfamiliar with the topic.

I love professor mcgraw. He is an amazing lecturer and makes me excited to go to class. You have to go to class to takes notes or else you won't pass. He doesn't have a carmen page. His slides are mostly pictures so he's not just reading off the slides. Really, really good lecturer and i highly recommend taking a class by him.

Dr. McGraw is my favorite professor at OSU. He sets very clear expectations for students and knows how to convey the material very clearly. An important point, he did not create a Carmen page for the course when I took it, and if you did not show up to class, you would not know what to study. The solution to this problem is to never skip class.

Tests were very difficult for someone who is not an anthropology major and taking for a GE, which i wouldnt recomend. He doesnt use Carmen & the tests are essentially 70% making lists and they are the only 3 grades. However, he's a really nice guy and interesting class. Just be prepared to study a lot for the exams. Especially do the readings.

Dr. McGraw is my favorite professor at OSU! I took this class just because I wanted to take another of his courses! You can tell he loves the subject and is clear on the information being presented! He is always willing to help when you don't understand and very approachable. All you have to do is show up and take notes and you should get an A

He's literally awesome. So passionate about his field, he makes you care too. But no Carmen so he have to go to the lectures. If you do, the three exams will be easy. Best professor I've had here yet.

Prof McGraw makes me want to be an Anthropology major.  He is clearly passionate about this subject, always makes class fun and interesting, and I genuinely wish this class was everyday.  The tests have a lot of material on them, but are really fair. Take it!!!!!!!!!!

He is very passionate about primates - but as a student who was looking for a generally easy GE this is definitely not the class to take. While we watched some videos and there are only THREE exams, it is a lot of time consuming memorization and attendance is mandatory to get the information. He does not post the slides. Very nice guy though.

Fantastic teacher. One of the best classes I have ever taken. I couldnt wait to go to his class everyday, it was so interesting! He is so passionate about what he does and it rubs off on you. Take this class!!!! You will LOVE it!

Dr. McGraw really loves the subject of Primatology.  His lectures are incredibly interesting.  He often shows videos that are very interesting and his personal stories are amazing and often times rather entertaining.
What can I say Dr. McGraw is the best.
he's a good guy

He is one of the best professors I've ever had. The tests can be difficult, but he goes over everything that you need to know in class, so attendance is very important. He is willing to answer any questions you have. Overall one of the best classes I've ever taken!

Loved this class. He was so passionate and knowledgeable about the subject. Make sure you read the book. Tests were more difficult than I thought they would be, but they were multiple choice. We had three midterms (one during finals week - not cumulative) and two novels we had to read and then write 6 pages on. TAKE THIS CLASS!! You won't regret it
Really interesting teacher. I never though about falling asleep in his class. Tests were harder than expected though. Take good notes, read the book, and study more than you think you need to.
The best professor I've ever had.
More work than I expected but he is so passionate about primates that it's contagious.
Very cool, interesting guy.  Always very eager to help and extremely personable.  Tests weren't hard as long as you studied the material, but attendance is really important.

He is so interested in what he is teaching you can't help but be interested as well.  He explains things thoroughly and engages the class.  He talks fast and it is sometimes hard to take notes, but still a GREAT professor!!!
Very engaging lecturer, interested in helping students, and honestly, hot as well.

classes are a lot of fun and always interesting--not one you'll wnat to sleep through.  he's always eager to give extra help if needed.  has all sorts of great primatology books in his office he lends out--take advantage of his library.
Great classes, a lot of fun, very nice to look at...
The class was tons of fun.  Take any classes that you can from him.  As an added bonus, he's not at all hard on the eyes.

Class is fairly difficult... you definitely have to pay attention and know your stuff. He makes class really fun though. Even stuff like dna that should be boring is more interesting when he talks about it. Plus he's hot.. always a plus.
Very animated and excited about anthropology. Only three tests and no other assignments. He's reallllly cute too!
He always acts out what he says...I wish he didn't cancel his primate sexuality class...I can only imagine!
The best primatologist out there!!
excellent teacher, excellent classes, a lot of fun.

Realy nice and helpful and like to have fun.  But he gives no study guides, so you better make sure you attend all the classes and make goood notes.  Also make sure your read all the articles, or else the class will be hard.
Best Professor at Ohio State!

Super charismatic and really wants his students to do well. Have to pay for a $45ish lab manual and lecture/labs are mandatory but no exams, just biweekly quizzes, module posters and weekly reflections

quizzes were completely open note, no midterm or final. four module poster assignments, but those we're fairly easy and don't need a lot of detail. labs every week which can take two hours depending on topic. tends to talk a lot and very fast in lectures so it can be hard to keep up, but overall he was very funny and interesting to listen to!
super nice professor who really cares about his students and making sure that we have the best educational experience possible.

Professor Hubbe is EASILY one of my all-time favorite professors.  His lectures were always fun to follow along and he always found a way to put his witty sense of humor into class.  The weekly workload was very manageable.  This is a great class to fulfill GE credits!
Very accommodating

Amazing guy, easy as that. The course consists of weekly labs and quizzes, and every three weeks there will be a summary of the lectures. He doesn't grade them, but everything comes straight from the slides. He is always willing to help and super understanding of anything that pops up.
Professor Hubbe is fun to listen to, and is very lose with due dates. He offers extra credit if you ask questions in class, and is great at explaining things in depth.
Didnt go to one class all semester. Had him for two courses. Best teacher ever. Very understanding. No due dates for the class. Easy A
Took this as an easy GE. There are weekly assignments, open note quizzes and 3 easy essays.

Dr. Hubbe did the lectures for this online course, which were recordings to be watched at any point of the week. Very good lectures from a passionate professor that is very helpful and knowledgeable if you're interested. Great person to have teaching the course.
we had loose due dates, he would rather our work be something we are proud of instead of getting it done on time.

solid course for natural science GE with a lab, summer term consists of 26 lectures(and a small reflection after each)+12 online labs+6 quizzes+ 4 study guides, the professor seems very passionate about the subject, lectures can be long and each lab might take you some time to complete but overall still a fairly easy and interesting class

Great person, amazing teacher. Course consists of lecture epiphanies/reflections, TopHat assignments, quizzes every other week, and occasional film essays -- all super doable & easy. Lectures a lot, but is open to questions/discussion from students. Understands students really well & makes class stress-free!
I really liked this class, along with the very interesting labs as wells. Overall an easy and enjoyable class.

This class was entirely asynchronous, but it was very easy. The Labs were simple and so were the Visual Study Guides. As long as you put effort into those, you should always get full credit. In terms of the quizzes, some of the questions are worded weird, but they follow the lectures. My only problem was with lectures; they are so long.

Professor Hubb is a great person, but not a good instructor. His course is hard to understand sometimes as his thoughts are jumping and without a clear main point. Some lab and quiz problems can be tough and tricky for those who had no experience of Anthropology before. Take this course as a GPA booster, but don't expect to learn a lot by taking it
Professor Hubbe is very funny and he cares about his students. He is extremely passionate about what he teaches. You do not need to buy the textbook.

You learn so much from his class and he is always very happy to help. Grading is very straight forward as long as you do the work. No exams, just bi weekly quizzes. Labs are a big part of your grade. You dont really need the book, only the lab notebook.

Very easy class. Mark is very lecture heavy and sometimes his lectures can be a bit dry. There are no exams just biweekly quizzes that are super easy. You can still turn in assignments late without any penalties.
Really helpful and accomodating. Doesn't mind if things are late as long as you do them and learn from them. No exams but multiple online quizzes.

This is a very easy GE lab credit. The lectures are all posted online, and you don't really need the textbook for anything. There are no tests, just biweekly quizzes online. The labs are very straightforward and interesting. Mark is very knowledgable about anthropology, so he is very willing to help anyone who needs it.
Wonderful professor!! Just a cool person and easy to talk to and cares about his students!! Would really recommend!!

Mark is super laid back. He cares about students, hates grading, and would rather focus his attention on making sure you gain something from the class than tearing you down. Great guy, great teacher. He can be a bit vague and scattered at times, though.

Mark was tough to understand sometimes and if you misspell things on quizzes you'd get points off, but there were always opportunities to get extra credit on quizzes and exams.  If you go to class and draw well (ok if you can decipher your own drawings), you'll be fine.
Great class just better be good at spelling or your grade will suffer

Respectfully, this guy's wasting my time. Can't wait to see how he's going to manage to yap for an entire hour each week the rest of the semester. The entirety of this course could be absorbed in one class period, but David seems to think we need to hear him repeat himself loudly ad nauseum. If you value your time, I recommend avoiding.

This class is incredibly easy but super boring. Attending lectures wasn't necessary at all and honestly was a waste of time. He didn't say anything of much substance during the hour-long class and I always regretted going whenever I did. The number of people attending class dropped dramatically after the first few weeks if that tells you anything.

This was for my mandatory freshman seminar- it was extremely easy but also extremely boring. While it could be taught in just one or two classes, he uses the entire hour every week. He also just reads off of power point slides which you could do by yourself.

He loves to hear himself speak and stand in front of a classroom. He makes the class extremely boring and takes it WAY to serious for basically a freshman seminar class. The informations helpful, but it can be don't within 20 minutes instead, he stretches the entire hour. Also all he does is read off the slides, thank you i can read!!!

HORRIBLE.  It has been three quarters now and I am still furious about this class.  I took it as a senior as one of my last GEC courses, I have a 3.8, and I got a B.  WHY?  Because I know more about him than I do about Anthropology.  He goes through about 100 P.P. slides a class...WORST class and teacher I have ever had.

He kinda cares and means well, but is incompetent. I don't remember a single time when he could answer a student's question with assurance.  Maybe its his lack of experience that is to blame. But he will go off the subject, talk about completely irrelavant things, and waste your time! Nice guy, but you'll have to self-teach to get good grade.

David is extremely helpful. He goes above and beyond to make sure you get an A in his class. Loves visitors during office hours and in genuine during and outside of class. Take Anthropology 202 it is extremely interesting!

Super easy professor for a gen ed. Most of the homework consists of online labs and weekly reflections, along with three module posters. No complaints. Plus the course content is actually pretty interesting.

Ben did an amazing job navigating this asynchronous class. He always explained things and left encouraging feedback on the module posters. He encouraged you to personalize the material to yourself in the reflections. Extremely understanding guy and the assignments are not too hard. I definetly recommend this class and professor.
Genuinely one of the nicest people I've had the opportunity of learning from. He's very forgiving when it comes to grading, and seems interested in the material he's presenting.

Ben is one of the best professors I've had here. I had a family emergency during the semester and he has been super understanding and helpful with my situation. The quizzes aren't exactly from the notes, they're more conceptual, but aren't bad. He makes the lectures entertaining and the labs are easy.

Dr. Kawa was absolutely amazing. He is great at making lectures engaging and interesting. He is very humorous and provides amazing feedback. Attendance is mandatory but he is very lenient and gives you a certain amount of absences. I always looked forward to going to his class.
Probably one of the best, most caring professors. His classes are great and he is very understanding of students needs. I would take this class again if I could!

Professor Kawa is the most down to earth teacher I've ever had. He is incredibly knowledgeable and empathetic. He takes a subject that is indescribably boring and makes it enjoyable. He may be may favorite Professor.
He responds to emails very quickly, and he always gives detailed feedback on students' assignments.
He's really dope, and the class is easy. Lectures are mandatory but you get 5 absences throughout the semester.

He was a very understanding teacher that knew college students needed a break every now and then. He made sure to get everyone involved in class in a comfortable welcoming way. The class felt like a fun group to be apart of

Every class/lecture/discussion was incredibly interesting. Hes respectful of each person in the class and is willing to be accommodating for whatever. Legitimately Ive gone out of class and other students will be talking about how much they love the prof and class.

Dr. Kawa is a lot of fun in class and obviously super passionate about his area of study. As long as you put a little bit of effort into the exam study guides and keep up with the readings, you won't have any problems. One of the best professors in the anthro department without a doubt.

Dr. Kawa is amazing. One of the top three professors I had at OSU and that's saying a lot because I had some great ones. He is really invested in helping students learn about what interests them and he is always smiling which makes coming to class much easier. Take his class if you can, you won't regret it.

Kawa is an AWESOME, caring professor who made this potentially boring class interesting and relevant. He has clear study guides for his exams and grades fairly easily. He does take regular attendance for a grade but is flexible about due dates if need be. Worst part was the group project because group projects. Take a class with him!

Dr. Kawa is an awesome professor. His class is very interesting and he really likes hearing  students' opinions and discussing in class. He is very funny and friendly and I highly recommend taking his class. The assignments aren't too difficult and they are usually fun. There are a few "pop" quizzes, but tells you when to expect them.

Great professor! He keeps lectures entertaining and interesting, and does a great job of relating to students. He is hilarious and keeps up to date with the times. His lectures are easy to understand. We had 2 online exams, 7 reading responses, and a couple group assignments. Very understanding and flexible with deadlines. Take him if you can!

Overall, it was a great class. He is clearly very intelligent and knowledgeable about what he teaches. The class has a major biological background, and although I don't have a biology background, I was able to understand the topics we spoke about for the most part. The class doesn't have a lot of grades, but the things that are graded are easy.

Great professor. He is the type that doesn't care for deadlines as he genuinely cares for students and worries more about whether we understood the material. He isn't big on exams as we just had papers in class which was weekly. This class was seminar style so attendance and participation matters. great conversations and overall great class.
Best professor I have had in my 3 years at Ohio State. He's such a caring person who wants his students to succeed and learn the material. Lots of papers for this course but all worth it.

Great class for science GE. Douglas Crews is a great professor that makes the class manageable and enjoyable. Just show up for the labs and the biweekly quizzes are not hard at all if you use his lecture slides.

I would definitely take another class with Crews. The material is pretty straightforward & interesting, plus the labs are easy. Its clear that he cares a lot about his students too; he made a point to get to know everyone in the class, and he was always understanding when people missed things for valid reasons. One of the best professors Ive had!

Dr. Crews is an amazing professor. Hes very laid back and funny. His labs are easy, but his course is very lecture-heavy and his tests are difficult to study for (study guides are not clear nor helpful). He has you write a 1 page paper over a scientific article every other week or so, but he grades easy and is very understanding.

I literally learned nothing in this class and would not recommend it. You can probably pick a class thats easy and youll actually learn in. Took a post test (not for a grade) at the end and knew as much as when I started. But, hes nice guy and labs are extremely easy. Weeklyish write ups on interesting articles are graded for completion.
Professor Crews is a great professor. He is super chill if you get to know him. The labs are pretty quick. Exams are not too difficult. Engage in the class and you'll do well.

Professor Crews was by far my favorite professor this semester! He is a genuinely good person and cares about his students. He gives BIG study guides and not everything on them is on the test, but if you pay attention and do a bit of studying you will get an A. His weekly article readings are actually really interesting!

Doug has been my favorite professor at OSU so far. He really cares a lot about his students and makes the effort to engage everyone. He goes through slides very quickly and the tests sometimes have pretty specific questions, but if you go to all the labs/classes, take good notes, study, and ask questions during the tests it's not hard to get an A!

Professor Crews is a great guy who always tried to make class enjoyable.
