He recognized that none of the people in my class were Anthropology majors, and he didnt pretend like the subjects were the most interesting thing in the world. The class was very boring, and the study guides were not very helpful when it came to the 3 exams. Awesome guy!

Lectures could get confusing, but if you put in the work he won't let you get a bad grade. Dr. Crews was funny and told a lot a great stories about field work. The grade was basically based on 3 midterms, but they were all curved, and he rounded up our grades if we attended class. Good GE choice for a bio science with a lab!

Check out his CV. He is great at self-promotion. If you deal with him you will find out at some point that he is really only interested in himself. He does very little fieldwork or lab work but he gets all the publications. He lets other folks do the work and he gets the credit. That's how it works. Enjoy.

The lectures aren't bad, and he likes to tell interesting stories of field work. Unfortunately, none of the lecture slides are online so you have to write everything down. The grades are almost completely from the three tests and those aren't too bad, but the study guides have too much on them that aren't even on the tests.

You must have a strong biology background to understand this class. I spend most of every class very very confused about what's happening because he expects you to have a ton of prior knowledge. He moves through things very fast and is very unclear.

Pretty straightforward. His study guides aren't 100% of what's going to be on the test, though, so watch out. Labs and projects are all easy - just do them! The tests are kind of hit-or-miss, so study for them. Definitely doable.

Worst professor I've experience thus far. Unhelpful, condescending, and worst of all, he based his class on 3 exams. After taking the exams, I felt I couldn't have studied any more in order to understand the material, simply because he figures that we should already know half of the material from other classes! Terrible. Just...don't do it.

If you come to class and pay attention, there is no way you shouldn't get an A even with minimal studying for exams. Easy class, but will be easier the more science knowledge you have. However he isn't the best in the hard science areas and at times he generalizes way too much and gets it wrong, the longer the explanation the more likely its wrong.

Really good teacher.  Just come to class and take notes.  EVERYTHING that will be on the test will be in his power points! Since he doesn't put his p.p. online, you have to come to class to get the notes.  Plus he explains things as he goes so just go to class!!  He can go a little quickly through the p.p. so just speak up and he will go back.

Crews is a very poor and unclear professor, his lecture slides are terrible, he jumps around way too much and his exams are unfairly hard.  If you are not a science major with a strong genetics background run and hide, this class is waaaayyyy too hard for a GEC and I have a 3.9 in my honors major.
What is Cultural Marxisim Douglas Crews? Do you think you can answer that without changing the subject or direction? Don't get philosophical on my butt!
Make sure you attend all classes even though they are not mandatory, don't buy the book, study your ass off for the tests because they are the only grade in the class

Great guy. Funny guy. Ask and you will receive all the help you need. He even told me to change the grade on a question for an exam once. However...you MUST go to class to get the notes for the test! Otherwise you better know someone who takes good notes or you are screwed. He runs through notes really fast too. best to take them via laptop.

don't buy the textbook. he only gives 3 tests for the final grade. each test has 33 (34 for the final) questions for 100 points total so each missed question is a percentage point off your final grade. difficult class but if you attend and take lots of notes you will be fine.

There is alot of information covered but as long as you take notes you'll be fine.  Dr. Crews is really funny and knowledgeable and the class is pretty straightforward.  The information did jump around a bit at times but didn't bother me.  As long as you go to class and take notes you'll be fine and won't need to buy the book.

Class is a very simple set-up. If you attend lecture and take notes you are nearly guarenteed an A. The study guides contain all information that will be on the test. The tests are very straight forward and uncomplicated. I read the book but found didnt contribute much information. Crews made the class rather enjoyable he has a good sense of humor.

Crews is obsessed with a few different topics; mutation, lynch syndrome, etc. His lectures are a bit unorganized but the worst is that his class is three tests, and only 100 points total. It's extremely hard to raise your grade. He's an okay teacher but the material is dry and lectures are long. Memorize notes and you'll be okay. Book wasn't used.

Crews is funny and makes class interesting. His slides are detailed and he goes through them quickly, then wont post them online. If you don't have a strong bio base, beware, he expects you to know a lot. Do the study guide and you'll be fine. Attendance is not mandatory but he takes it randomly, and it will help you're grade a lot if you attend.

I have always loved his class. You dont have to buy the book if u just show up. but if not the study exams let u know what to look up if u missed a class. PLUS all the tests are multiple choice, some are tricky but they are relatively easy. ALSO he's funny, which keeps u from being bored!

I knew most of the information coming into the class already, so it may be harder for people without a background in biology.  He does focus a lot on the genetics and biology behind anthropology so if that's not your thing, beware.  His tests were pretty easy: multiple choice. He did have some tricky questions but over stuff he emphasized in class.
OK in class but way too self important one-on-one. has time to make smart ass comments but no time to answer real questions. disorganized and not really interested in the students down deep.

Don't take his class unless you are interested in biological anthropology. He doesn't use the textbook, so it's very important to go to class and pay attention. Yes, he does go through the lectures quickly and he doesn't give outlines, but he is always willing to explain something again. Awesome professor, I'm sad to be leaving him.

Fortunately I am not planning on having children - Dr. Crews' focus on mutations is scary stuff.  Because he does not follow a textbook, it would be helpful if he provided a better outline, more information on the web or less detailed powerpoints.  I found I could listen to his lecture, make notes from his slides, but could not manage both.

He is really nice & funny, but unless you are really into bio and physical anthro, you will hate his class! he is obesessed with hardy and wineberg.. plus his ta sucked and never answered any of my questions.
Fun, interesting class.  Not that easy, but easy enough. Funny, charming guy!
Very clear during lectures and though his notes weren't always organized his speech was.

As stated before, very molecular genetics based. For a 301 course, he goes a bit too in depth. The worst part was the review, it was very broad and was impossible to know what to expect! Quite disorganized, TA very unhelpful and gave me the wrong answer 2 times. Crews himself is a nice guy, but I would appreciate more structure and concise review.

Very molecular based for a 301 course. His lectures are a bit disorganized, but everything is fairly straight forward. Exams were not as easy as I thought; the review was way too in-depth and it was hard to know exactly what was expected. If you have a good background in bio or physical anthro, you will do fine though.

Great professor, very fair and knows his stuff. He is very interested in teaching and although lectures are sometimes are a little bit disorganized, they are very clear once you keep up with his pace. He is always there to help students. Not tricky, but you have to study and know the material. One of the best teachers I have ever had!
Not a bad class overall.  Lots of in-depth material, but if you ignore the super-detailed stuff and pay attention to the general trends, you'll be fine.  The study guides were great.

Slightly disorganized, but knew what he was talking about.  Keep up with the reading,  and pay attention to lectures - you will be fine.  Wasn't expecting the mol gen material, but pleased.  Grad students were a surprise, but our grades were not combined, so I don't think it was a problem.

Very disorganized.  This class was combined with graduate students, which was kind of overwhelming.  Had to work my ass off to get a good grade.  Very molecular genetics based material, which wasn't what I expected.

I accidentally took the intro to archeology course when I thought I had taken the intro to anthopology. Still if you're into learning the names and structure of the tools that ancient humans used, learning the culture, traditions, beliefs, etc then this class is for you. Don't worry about the professor, he's very kind and understanding. Up to you.

Alexandra was a great instructor! She organized the course material clearly and was always willing to help students. She's genuinely passionate about the class material (even though she wasn't our lecturer), and she always responds to students quickly. She's understanding of any issues you encounter and is flexible with deadlines if you reach out!

Professor Tuggle was a pleasure to have as an instructor. Every assignment in this class is graded by completion other than the quizzes and the graphical summaries, which are very easy. She was also very flexible in regard to extensions. Easy A!

Instructor Tuggle was a great instructor and always had enthusiasm during lectures. You can tell she knows her stuff, enjoys her field, and shares her experiences. This class was enjoyable and recommend taking it with her.
She is an amazing teacher I would recommend her to everyone. Super caring and loves what she does !

Alex is an extremely nice, caring professor. This class is very easy to get an A in as long as you just go to class. The labs are very easy and actually pretty fun as well. Highly recommend taking any class with Alex that you can!

Alex is a grad student here for Anthropology and it's clear she's passionate about the class and subject, which make easier to learn! She's always willing to answer questions during labs and is really accessible through her office hours. Great professor, not a difficult class. I definitely recommend taking this GE.
She is extremely passionate about the subject and always willing to help her students! Her tests are super easy and she is super cute!
Easy class, show up, take notes, look at them and you're solid. The department sets the whole lab stuff and quizzes but those are easy just do them and come. The instructor was pretty chill.

Easiest science GE only because it was with Alex. She's stellar, and is really approachable. She definitely knows her stuff and loves it. If you ever need anything she's there to help and is really cool about grades because she knows what its like to be in college. Oh, and she makes her lectures really entertaining! 10/10 would recommend.

This class was async, so did not have a lot of interaction with her. That being said, she was a very fair grader and expectations were clear. The class is very cut and dry, but I wish the modules unlocked further in advance so I could work ahead.

I took this class asynchronously, so I can't say I had too much experience with Professor Green, but she gave good feedback on assignments, and was always super responsive and helpful whenever I emailed. The class material itself also isn't difficult, would recommend for a GE
Very kind professor who knows a lot about his field. Labs were very fun and informative.

Dr. Larsen is an incredible anthropologist & instructor. He's easy to talk to, very understanding, & super enthusiastic about the classes he teaches. While the courses are read-heavy & sometimes lecture-heavy, they're enjoyable & informative as well as fascinating. It's a lot of work, but it's ez to get an A if you follow assigned readings & lectur

Super interesting class and Professor Weiss is so kind. If you actually care and do the work like it is supposed to be done, she can tell and really get to know your work. If you just watch the lectures, which are super interesting if you like Anthropology, this class is an easy A. Quizzes every once in a while, easy weekly online labs, no final.
Great lecturer. She is super friendly and the test is mostly memorization. Go to class and lab because the test is mostly based on those. You will need to buy a lab manual but that is it.

A very nice person, obviously very passionate about her field. Very knowledgeable and not too strict with grading. A fair amount of work (quizzes, readings, discussion posts, project). Don't bother reading the book if you're going to lectures (however, she wrote the book and gives you access for free!) The only warning is the group project.

I don't understand the negative reviews Dr. Field has. I was so scared of taking this course with her because of the reviews but was surprised by how amazing she is. She is clear about what she wants and has been one of the most amazing professors during the pandemic. The workload is the usual and nothing insanely hard if you read the material.

Dr Field can be very moody either in a great mood or very spiteful. She also grades quite rigidly on some things but others she does not for instance, the second paper we had to write everyone in the whole class got a 100% the third paper I received a 60 because I misinterpreted instructions. Reading are from POORLY written online pdf textbook.

Dr. Field is very knowledgeable and wants students to participate in her class. However, when you do, she doesn't always seem to appreciate it. Also, when you go to office hours, she doesn't always seem to be grateful of your time and makes the appointment seem rushed and isn't always conducive to asking more questions that what you came in for.

Dr. Fields was a great professor to have. The class lectures can be a bit boring at times, but she is good for a joke every now and then, which kept me awake. The class did not have many assignments (most grades being tests). The test are not too bad as long as you study.

Dr. Field was a great professor.  The class could be a little dry, but she tried to make it interesting and do different sorts of activities.  The tests were easy and she didn't grade any of the assignments particularly hard.  Overall, I would take another class with her.

I personally found the lectures and reading very dry. Maybe because I took this as a GE, I don't know, but I didn't really like the class. I felt the class topics were sometimes a little scattered feeling.

Dr. Field is simply awesome. Not only is she smart, but she is also incredibly organized and overall a pleasant person. She assigns SO MUCH READING THOUGH! Still, I would take another class with her in a heartbeat.

He is very passionate and knows what he's talking about, but I found the tests to be harder than people said. Only needed to put in about one hour of effort a week in the class though and it was all online. Pretty easy A for a GE but some test questions were nowhere to be found in the lectures and he doesn't post the slides so you have to take note

For the subject he made the online course pretty interesting. I struggled on the tests and when I reached out for help he was more than enthusiastic to help me and offer advise which did end up helping. He uses Prezi for notes and then does either a quiz or a discussion post usually once a week. The exams were not too bad just detail oriented.
Very easy. Barely put in any effort.

He's readily available outside class if you have any issues with course related material and also regularly sends out updates that are very useful. Since this is an online course, there wasn't much else to add but he did his job perfectly.

Tim was great. I don't expect a ton from GE's like Anthro2200 but Time made class enjoyable and easy. He is passionate about the material and the class requires very little effort to receive an A. Would absolutely take again.

Tim is basically Ross from Friends. That being said he can lose his train of thought sometimes but he always pulls it back to the class and what we will be tested on. Hilarious lectures (as funny as Anthro can be) Definitely recommend taking this class. He is also very good at addressing student concerns and questions. Would for sure take again!!

Tim is very quick with responding to emails. Also, provide clear details if you ask him a questions.  He seems very passionate about Anthropology. His lectures are helpful, but if you substitute with reading, you should be fine.  Make sure you pay attention to the discussion board, they are easy and he makes it fun. Pay attention to essay question

All work can be done one day a week. Lectures on Prezi vary in length from 20 slides to 60. There are 3 tests. A couple discussion boards. Lab quizzes and lab every week. Lecture and quiz do not align every week so you have to use the online lab companion to understand quizlab. But he grades easy and it is interesting.

The best online science GEC you could take. Quiz and Lab every week and an occasional discussion board every 2-3 weeks or so. 3 exams which come directly from the lectures. Great Professor and is easy to get in contact with. If you are a not a science major but need a physical science GEC this is the class you should take.
Wonderful class. Actually got me interested in anthropology, influenced my decision on majors.  Very easy, but a very capable teacher.

One of my favorite professor's. Tried to make boring topics fun, kept lecture interesting. No book use, very easy labs and tests. I highly encourage anyone to take this class that needs and easy science with a lab.

Amazing professor. Makes you genuinely interested in the material which might otherwise be dry. This was one of my favorite classes I've taken at OSU. If you go to class and the review days you will definitely get a good grade.
Very easy to understand.  Made the class fun and interesting.
She was great!! Labs are completion and reflections are 50-100 words (opinion/relatable) graphical summaries can be resubmitted for better score/ no specific due dates
Really well designed and organized course, lectures are really engaging and fun to learn. Also a relatively easy class.

Emma Lagan is a gifted instructor who clearly loves to teach and loves anthropology. She's very amiable and has an ability to get the gears turning in her students (including myself) in a way I've never seen. The entire classroom is constantly engaged and asking questions.; she always lays out what is expected and follows the syllabus.

Best teacher I have ever had! She truly made the class interesting. Went above and beyond to help students understand the material. Class wasnt too hard. Shes hilarious and truly cares about her students she learned each and every one of our names. Take her class you wont be disappointed!
Julie is the best!!
Lecture heavy

Sweetest and most caring professor I’ve had at OSU. Extremely accommodating and changed deadlines for student needs. She will make your life extremely easy and you will absolutely not regret taking her class. You can also see her passion through interesting lectures and labs. Super nice and you would have to try extremely hard to not get an A.

Throughout the semester, the class was super unorganized where we were doing lab assignments 1 week before we had lecture about the information She is honestly not that good at public speaking which makes lecture really hard to pay attention to and actually understand the information. The class is super easy though everything is completion graded.
very unfair

It was an easy GE class mainly because it was online. Like one discussion per week, one quiz per week (easy to look up questions online), and 3 workbooks in total (so like one per month). The workbooks are small projects. Good easy class and she responds to emails fast too!

Graded off 2 tests (fairly difficult but not too much so) and 4 papers (the last worth far more then previous ones). She doesn't post lectures online so either read the book or don't and come to class. (don't need book if go to class).  Lectures are ok. She is not harsh on grading earlier papers. Overall, she is average.

Gremillion is super knowledgable. Entire class was lecture so they can feel long and especially due to the topic be very dry. Can come off as intimidating at first but she's very nice. Easy grader on research papers/essays but the two midterms were pretty hard. Participation grade based on attendance. 3 essays, 2 midterms, research paper, final
Worst professor i ever had

Dr. Gremillion is a great professor.  It is mostly lecture, but if people start asking questions then class can quickly turn into a large discussion.  If you come to class and do her assignments you will do fine.  If you actually read that books/textbooks you'll do even better.

Very laid back class with interesting topics that can spark some intriguing discussion.  Three one page writing assignments that are easy, and a final project on a plant of your choice.  Very laid back class.
Worked harder than i have for any class before and didnt get an A for the first time. boring as hell and she grades hard on the exams, she also has no personality whatsoever

Literally one of the most boring classes I've taken. Two hours of her going over slides, without much participation from the class. She offered study guides for her exams, which helped, and told to study from those. But then some of her exam questions were different! Very frustrating.
Dr. Gremillion is super laid-back and class has an easy-going feel to it. Her lectures are more like conversations and class discussions are usually pretty interesting.

Class is very laid back, but somehow she makes the material interesting. Very kind woman. Homework assignments are very easy. Final project on a plant of your choosing. Highly recommend taking this as a GEC - it definitely beats taking actual biology courses.
enjoys teaching, cares about students and it shows
Class was enjoyable--Willing to help!

Dr. Gremillion is great. I took her class last fall and she is really enthusiastic about what she studies. Her tests are tough, all essay, but very fair. You have to study hard, and you'll do well. Exactly how an honors class should be taught. Great job Dr. G! :)

Kris has a great personality.  Even when we are working with really dry material, she is fun-loving, and the class gets into really meaningful discussions sometimes, even when they stray from the course some.  She is very nice and always willing to help you learn.  Plus, I think the course subject matter is very interesting to begin with.
a bit boring, but that is mainly due to the material itself. she is very nice and helpful; plus, her study guides are just about right on the money. i would take a class with her again.

Her exams are all essay pretty much; she gives you a list of terms and you have to give a short description; some require more though, and there is a big essay at the end. Her reviews helped a lot and she is very approachable. I would recommend her.
She def. expects than I thought initially. of course, it beats taking the class with mccort.!
Her lectures and exams/assignments are completely different worlds. She expects more than you first think!

For being an honors class, it was actually kinda easy. The lectures were pretty dull, though. Good luck staying awake in class, but the tests aren't too hard. All the material is straight from the powerpoints.

Worst class I've ever had. Every day I went I wanted to shoot myself just so I wouldn't be bored anymore. She teaches monotone and doesn't tell you anything you can't get off a PBS documentary about prehistoric cultures (and yes, she was in one). If you don't have any interest in old bones and pointless information, stay away. At least she's nice.

I found the material extremely boring, but can't blame that on the professor.  Dr. Gremillion was really a nice teacher and was helpful in teaching me.  Studying for the exams was mostly memorization.  She grades easy on exams and papers and gave a lot of good insight.
The class was interesting.  Not too hard, not too easy.  Pretty run of the mill.

I LOVED THIS CLASS! at first i thought it was boring, but dr.g's insight made it all really interesting. a very understanding and helpful prof. tests came directly from outlines she gave out, and we only had one big essay due at the end of the quarter.
First of all, it's Kris - she's a woman.  Second, she was great, engaging, and knowledgeable.  A fun class with the discussion.  A lot of memorization, but a lot of thinking exercises as well.

I did very well in this class considering the time I put into it. I attempted to take notes in the class until I would fall asleep. I found her very interesting though. She's a nice lady and her tests are easy. I learned some things from this class.
Awesome human being, with lectures and tests that are clear and well designed. If you have an opportunity to take any course from this professor do so!
I did not think I would enjoy this class as much as I did. The lectures were interesting, the workload was fairly light in my opinion, and Dr. Kane was a really great and understanding professor.
Erin is great. She is super clear and knows what she is doing. If you show up, you will pass. It's really not that difficult and she is nerdy and fantastic.
She is a kind teacher, but her class and exams are not easy.
Very good and enthusiastic teacher.

Overall, this was a relatively easy course and Dr. McGuire did a pretty good job of instruction. As others have said, she grades but does not present in the video lectures. I do wish she was clearer with her expectations and reviewed the course content before posting it. Some of her expectations contradicted what the assignments said.

Dr. McGuire was very understanding when it came to late assignments and even gave us up to 10 assignments to have regarded throughout the semester. The lectures themselves are not recorded by Dr. McGuire. Lecturer seems to really know what he's talking about, but if you're just taking this as a GE like I am, it's very easy to fall asleep.

Her carmen page is well-made and is easy to navigate, the course is clearly outlined, assignments are easy, and the weekly labs are mostly completion. No exams, just biweekly quizzes that are not hard if you paid attention. The lectures were recorded by someone else, and were also very good and enjoyable. Very good as a asynchronous online course.

She was awesome as a professor. Her carmen page was easy to navigate through weekly modules. So understanding of COVID and lenient when given reasoning. Weekly discussion posts and intriguing challenges. Open note quiz almost weekly. Highly suggest taking this course!

Dr. McGuire is hands down the best. She is so caring about her students and especially genuine. She was a student not too long ago so she definitely understands mental health issues and is very understanding about things that may pop up. 10000/10 would recommend as a interesting elective that youll get something out of. Love Dr. McGuire!
-Content was very boring but a course easy to pass if you complete all assignments. Professor was organized but wasn't the most helpful.

Fair class. If you read the syllabus and chapters in the book, review the lectures, and do the homework on time, it's an easy A. Exam questions come right from the course (textbook/lectures/online resources she posts), and she gives study guides ahead of time so you know exactly what's on them.
Awful. Group projects for online classes. Insanely long online lectures and very specific, very useless questions on tests.

This is not an easy online class.  I was told it was, it's not.  It's the most boring class/lecture I've ever participated in.  It honestly probably isn't that hard, but lectures are so boring that you literally cannot make it through them.  There is WAY too much content and is WAY tto in depth for an intro class.
I took this class as an online course. As long as you post to the weekly discussion and make sure to keep up with the labs, its an easy A. The exams are all online and straight outta the book.

Dr. Clark is a caring and understanding professor. This class is a discussion style course. Attendance is not mandatory but you are expected to journal on the topics we discuss each week (basically your thoughts nothing too heavy). There are no tests, no homework, no quizzes, and no final. Overall it's a valuable course to take.

She is a wonderful teacher. She loves her field and loves when students are interested and ask questions. I have had her for all of my anthro courses and I look for classes she teaches just to have her again. She gets to know her students and takes the time to learn about them. She is funny and creates an environment that makes you want to show up

I never review on here but Melissa deserves it. I took this class as an easy GE and didnt expect to like it but she makes this class interesting an fun. She is funny and nice and truly cares about her students more than everything especially for teaching a gen ed class where most people arent doing it as their major. Take her class!!
Very caring professor and a very easy A course. Keep in mind that every class is a group work class. People will be in your face all. the. time.

I can't sing Melissa's praises enough. Took her class to fulfill a GE, and so glad I did. Her class really focuses on developing you as a person and personal growth- she wants you to succeed. I work in policy now, and her class has really helped me be more aware of the interactions of the world around me. Take this class!

Melissa's class was super easy but I just don't feel like I really learned anything. If you are looking for an easy A this is the class to take. If you do poorly on an assignment she lets you fix your mistakes to get a higher grade.

This course has truly challenged my worldview, and her teaching style is conducive to true learning- there are never quizzes/tests, so there is no pressure to learn the material for temporary use only. She truly cares about her students, and wants you to learn without anxiety. Every educator should be like Melissa.

I really really liked Melissa as my anthropology teacher and I would highly recommend her. I had 2 lectures (1 hour and 20 minutes each) and a lab and I never once didn't think the class didn't go fast. She is so funny and she keeps the lectures interesting. She really is passionate about anthropology and everyone should take her class!

Took this class as a GE (not my major), she presents the material in a fun and interesting way that made me enjoy lecture. Easiest 4 credit class I've taken here, everything is straightforward and interesting if you give it a chance.

Took her in Autumn 2017 and her teaching style is mediocre at best. She shows to many videos and complains about her students a lot and does not expect that students need to hold their Professors to certain standards as well. There is a reason most of us choose the traditional setting versus the online setting.
Overall the class experience was great but believes people learn by quizzes rather then applying the material.
Professor Young is amazing at what he does. I had known nothing about the subject at the beginning and the class changed my whole world view. He is incredibly knowledgeable and empathetic.

Tough grader, every time i believe that i did well on a written and fix what she asks of me too I still never get a 100% or even 90%. 10-15 page final that is a lot a work. She is a very political teacher who talks about presidential candidates and makes it obvious where she stands. over half of the class switched out.

She is is a decent teacher who has mediocre lecturing skills. All you do is sit around and discuss articles from class. The articles are very long and extremely boring. She gives very hard quizzes over the articles. I would not recommend. If you have to take this class, then I would recommend taking a different professor.

Awesome professor! She is so helpful and understanding! She allowed discussions to be uncensored so it could really go anywhere, and she encourage new refreshing outlooks to be represented during discussions. If she was teaching a different course I would definitely sign up!

Awesome professor! She is so helpful and understanding! She allowed discussions to be uncensored so it could really go anywhere, and she encourage new refreshing outlooks to be represented during discussions. If she was teaching a different course I would definitely sign up!
Ms. Walz is a very nice girl and her outfits are cute. Don't buy the textbook.
If you pay attention in class and read the class is easy. No surprises on her testes. Very informative! Excellent teacher!
No Comments

Completely asynchronous class, so I didn't interact with her a lot, but over email and Canvas she was very helpful. She wants every student to pass the class and if you put in any amount of effort, you'll do well. She made the class more interesting than I thought it would be.
Wonderful Professor very helpful, this class was lots of fun and very interesting.
Dr. Hinkleman knows what she is doing and wants all of her students to pass the class. Overall the class is very easy because she is a very easy grader.

I greatly appreciate how much I was able to learn about people and our world. This course was very open-ended, and the professor was very insightful. If you enjoy sharing your thoughts, or simply wish to broaden your perspective, don't miss out on this course.

Professor Betz has a huge interest in the subject that she teaches and genuinely wants her students to succeed. Open note quizzes, optional lectures, and a very flexible late work policy. If you have the chance to take her - please do. She's really an awesome person.

Barbara was a great professor and she made this class interesting. The notes were posted online and the online lab quizzes were easy. There were 3 tests which make up the majority of your grade. The labs were easy and you got 100% for showing up and doing the work. I would definitely recommend her as a professor for this course.
3 tests total very easy class. Test's are not hard, notes are posted online. Labs are basically automatic 100%. Easiest lab classes at osu.

She's really funny and kind, but the only real assignment is a term paper. It's broken up into parts so you get multiple grades but beware if papers aren't your thing. Weekly discussion boards and one class discussion that you have to lead but could get an A on those in your sleep. Very interesting class/readings

Best teacher at OSU Clearly loves her students and would do anything to make them feel more comfortable in the class You can skip lecture but then you'll have to read the book If you go to lecture the exams are really easy Im talking over 97 on every exam I actually learned a lot from this class, probably my favorite class at OSU

Emily is a gift. She genuinely cares if you understand the material or not. I came from a Christian school, so I had no base knowledge of anything relating to the course, yet she went out of her way to make sure I genuinely understood everything. She's also just absolutely adorable.

This class made me question being an anthropology major. The content was interesting, but she managed to make the learning tedious and surface level. She does not adequately explain the biological side of what she teaches, leaving students to try to decipher what she meant. Lectures were hastily thrown together with typos and poor formatting.

I have also taken ANTH3302 with her. She can be very straight-forward and a little intimidating, but her lectures are great and they spark awesome conversation in class. She expects participation and will call on you if you are not talking. Her exams definitely require work, but I was able to get an A+ in both of her classes.

Here's the deal about this professor: if you don't think like her, you will lose points. She does not have a grading rubric and her grading logic is statistically messed up. The course is quite interesting, but I wish they had a graduate student or even other professors teach it.

There are a lot of readings and videos that are you are required to watch outside of class, but they all have a purpose. She loves having discussions with the class because she genuinely cares about what you think! She is a little intimidating at first, but she is extremely caring and wants what is best for her students and her tests reflect this.

Dr. Piperata is awesome. She knows the material very well, and if you mention something she doesn't know, she'll look it up and get back to you in the next class or two. I never read any of the readings except right before the tests, but they were interesting when we had discussions on them. I'm excited to take another class of her's in the fall.

Amazing professor and intellectually stimulating class. However, a lot of reading as I took it for a GE - very participation heavy as the class is seminar style. Exams are based on a lot of material. Had to put in a lot of work for the class but generally did not mind because I enjoyed Dr. Piperata and the subject matter was so interesting

Dr. Piperata is no-nonsense. This reflects in a clearly structured class and difficult grading. She really makes you work if you want an A. You will come away from her classes with a wealth of new knowledge and skills.

I really enjoyed this class. If you're good at memorizing test answers, you'll be fine. I found her power points really useful, so while she doesn't take attendance, I recommend going for the notes. If you're a good listener and test taker, this is the class for you. I'm not an anthro major, but I was interested in the topic for a GE.

I liked the class. I thought she was a good teacher and very interesting to listen to. I did find her exams to be very difficult. I felt like she asked  slightly obscure questions and many of the answers I could easily have talked myself into. I hate tests with "D.All of the Above...E.None of the Above..." answer choices for all the questions

Amazing. She is not going to spoonfeed you info just to spew back - if that's the kind of prof you want, move along. She will challenge you to think for yourself (wow, what a concept in an academic environment!) and to analyze things on your own. She expects you to have read your assignments and to actively participate in class. Loved every minute!

Terrible Professor-avoid at all costs! Doesn't list assignments on syllabus, must check class site. Not helpful in class or outside. Tests on trivial things that she says. Does not explain what she actually wants. Sincerely interested in this topic wish I would have taken ANYONE else.

The worst professor I've had at OSU.She made an otherwise interesting class dreadful.Readings are extensive but more useful than her lectures which are so fast and sporatic your head will spin.Her exams are impossible,and in no way represent your knowledge of the subject.Very unhelpful I have a 3.8 in my Anth major and got a C in her class AVOID!

Barbara is the most wonderful professor I have had at OSU so far. If I had taken her class earlier on in my undergrad years I may have changed my major. Barbara challenges you and pushes you to think for yourself. There is a lot of reading, but I really enjoyed her choices. I am a science major and got an A. Everyone should have to take this class.

Dreadful...she is the worst teacher in the anthro department hands down. you will never write all of her notes since she goes so fast, but you'll be tested over every tiny detail. If you don't care about making an A or B, then she's the prof for you, otherwise wait for someone else to teach your course.

Not a good professor at all. A TON of reading, and no textbook to clarify what we did in class. She spoke so fast that you can't write it all down AND copy all the notes from her slides, but she expects you to get both magically. She was useless in office hours and ignored emails about when help was needed. AVOID!!!!!

If you aren't interested/don't really care about the topic then I would avoid taking her class.  That said, if you are an ANT major or you are legitimately interested then she is one of the best professors out there. Always pushing you to think for yourself and very approachable, not to mention attractive.
Not my fav prof.. can be interesting but relatively boring. Mainly about discussion, alot of reading, and some debate. Tests not really off the lectures, and must be very detailed during test.

The class was interesting but there is a TON of reading. Liked the class discussions but they got a little repetitive after a while. Weekly reading quizzes asked for the most abstract details and prof. didn't care that almost the whole class failed almost all of them. If your not an anthro major avoid this class! Not helpful at all in office hrs.

This class involved a lot of reading, and was taught purely as a discussion class. It was interesting to hear everyone's comments, although lectures may have been helpful. She gave almost weekly quizzes, which contained questions purely about what points she thought were interesting, so being good at mind reading professors thought processes might
one of my favorite instructors at osu. fun AND funny AND cute, i would recommend her to everyone i know

She is a horrible teacher, in addition to being a horrible person. She is nasty to the students she doesn't like and will tell you up front that she rolls her eyes at students she has problems with. She will talk about you behind your back and give you an unfair grade. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

I really enjoyed Barabara's teaching method. She was extremely helpful and friendly outside of class. The material she presented was interested, and everything on her exams comes straight from her lectures. I would definitely take another one of her classes.

One of the worst proferssors I've had at OSU. Not willing to help students outside of class. Always complaining about how busy she is. She used to teach at a semester school so she rushed through material to shove it into a quarter. Midterms were not based off lectures like she claimed. Avoid this class! Unless you have a strong bio background..

Mackie is super caring. Class is a definitely has work but very manageable. Everything due at the end of semester including the easy quizzes that are not bad as long as you study. Labs are completion. I procrastinated till the last two weeks and still got done with an A. She is very understanding and passionate about the subject which makes it fun

Mackie is the sweetest. Class is a decent amount of work, but not hard at all. She did not have a certain due date for anything, you could work at your own pace. However, I highly recommend working throughout the semester because it will be a lot if you let everything pile up. She gave the whole class a two-day extension at the end of the semester.

Mackie is incredibly passionate about teeth and makes a scientific subject interesting to non-science majors. Her voice is really calming, so I enjoy watching her lecture videos, and all of the assigned work for the week is broken up nicely. Shes a really understanding, genuine person who just wants to help students dip their toes into Anthro.
Difficult language. Super technical. GE Online Class but is taken way to seriously. Way more difficult than need be.

Mackie is a super super good instructor! Her passion on studying teeth engages me lot on learning anthropology! All the answers on the exams can be reviewed through lecture PowerPoints, and she is really patient if you have any simple question! Her office hour will indicate some of significant points that MIGHT appear on the exams!
Professor Downey genuinely wants his students to succeed. A lot of the class is learning through experience and discussing in groups. Definitely recommend taking the class with him.

I had him for an online course. He is very kind. He seems well educated. The class is insanely easy and barely took me any time to complete the work. But I would recommend putting in more effort than I did so you can get the most out of the class. It is very eye-opening and can change how you think.

I love Evonne! Super sweet and flexible with due dates if you're really busy at times. Labs went well with quizzes/lecture content. They say quizzes don't test you over lab content but I thought labs were good material to study for them.

Evonne is a great teacher, and she is always quick to answer emails with any questions. She is also super lenient about deadlines. The only bad thing about the class is that lectures don't always cover information on quizzes, but you can still easily get a good grade if you do the labs and epiphanies.
Evonne was cool but the labs are a lot of work
The lab requires a lot of work, her 2200 is not an easy GE class!
There was a lot of stuff for a 6 week course but Evonne was great.

The content was all pretty easy and would be very manageable if you take it during a normal semester (wouldnt recommend taking this over the summer as theres a lot of content and very little time). I didnt really like Evonne though, she was just rude whenever I emailed her and not very accommodating for me.
Evonne was super friendly and flexible. Great teacher.
Evonne is great, answers emails quicky. The labs don't always work though.
Really like intro to Anthropology last semester. Professor Turner-byfield is super cool.
He gave me a zero on a paper with no explanation. He would also change due dates on assignments constantly, making it confusing for everyone.

Good guy and obviously very informed and passionate about archaeology. Sometimes lectures can get a little dry but can supplement the material with readings. Easy for GE credit but put in the average amount of work because there are 1-2 assignments a week. For somebody who wasnt interested in archaeology this class wasnt bad.

Great guy and obviously passionate about archaeology. Tries his best to make every assignment clear for you to get all of the points. Most everything is effort based. I have absolutely no interest in archaeology but he has made it pretty accessible. One to two assignments per week but they take very little time. This class should be a GPA boost.
One of my favorite lecturer. The class is easy and exams are just things directly from the slides. Definitely recommend this class with her.
